Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
I'm merely saying 2 things:
1) If someone's excuse for not sharing work they did is somehow related to a license I added to a worthless alpha repo (that everyone who has touched it has done more than I did), then the excuse is bullshit.
2) imo, it's pretty shitty to build upon a repo that was wholly intended *for the community* to share *for free* and then talk "I don't do for free" (without free work by someone who had 0 financial gain and actually loses revenue by the existence of the repo, the repo never would have even existed)

Content: Just my 2¢

Author: house#8741
Content: *electromagnetic radiation which, according to theory, should be emitted by a black hole. The radiation is due to the black hole capturing one of a particle-antiparticle pair created spontaneously near to the event horizon.*

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but hawking was wrong!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: Unfortunately, Susskind's proposed solution is even more difficult, and almost impossible to envisage or explain in an understandable way. He suggests that, as an object falls into a black hole, a copy of the information that makes it up is sort of scrambled and smeared in two dimensions around the edge of the black hole. Furthermore, Susskind believes that a similar process occurs in the universe as a whole, which raises the rather alarming idea that what we think of as three-dimensional reality is in fact something like a holographic representation of a "real" reality, which is actually contained in two dimensions around the edge of the universe.
